metadata.Title: CVE-2011-3741 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description: Ganglia 3.1.7 allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information via a direct request to a .php file, which reveals the installation path in an error message, as demonstrated by host_view.php and certain other files.

notes.Note: debian> NOT-FOR-US: Web app path disclosure, not an issue (path is known anyway) msalvatore> I'm retiring this because the version of ganglia in trusty is 3.6.0-1ubuntu2, vs the affected version of 3.1.7. Additionally, Debian has this labeled as "NOT-FOR-US".

criterions.comment: ganglia: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
